tit.cmt: タイトルなのでOracleだけでは、不十分です。

sen.j: 神勅（しんちょく）とは神の与えた命令、またその文書をさす言葉である。
sen.e: Oracle is a kotoba designating orders given by God and its monjo (written material).
Shinchoku is a word that refers to Heaven's will, and also its writing.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除し、必要なスペースを加えました。Kotobaの補足がありません。書き直しました。
sen.e: Shinchoku is a word that refers to Heaven's will, and also its writing.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天壌無窮の神勅
sen.e: tenjomukyu (as eternal as heaven and earth) no shinchoku (oracle)
Tenjomukyu no Shinchoku (the oracle that lasts eternally with heaven and earth)
sen.cmt: 文が小文字で始まっています。不要なスペースを削除し、必要なスペースを加えました。「-no-」 つなぐ単語はその後に補足がないとnoの意味が分からなくなります。書き換えました。
sen.e: Tenjomukyu no Shinchoku (the oracle that is as eternal as heaven and earth)
sen.cmt: 天地のように永遠であることなのでthe oracle that lasts eternally with heaven and earth→the oracle that is as eternal as heaven and earthとしました。

sen.j: 一般的に神勅といえば、『日本書紀』の天孫降臨の段で天照大神が孫のニニギらに下した以下の3つの神勅（三大神勅）のことを指す。
sen.e: when you say oracle, it generally refers to the below 3 orders (3 major orders) that Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) commanded to Ninigi in the paragraph of tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess) of "Chronicles of Japan".

In general, Shinchoku refers to following three shinchoku (Three Great Shinchoku) that were given by Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) to her grandson Ninigi (God of the Harvest) in the passage of Tensonkorin (the descent of the Sun-Goddess's grandson) recorded in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 文が小文字で始まっています。数字の表記を修正します。「三大神勅」を3 major ordersではなく、「Three Great Shinchoku」と訳しました。ニニギの補足として、稲穂の豊饒を示す穀霊神、という意味から、(God of the Harvest)としました。「天孫降臨」の補足ですが、新和英大辞典より、 (the descent of the Sun-Goddess's grandson)を使用します。書き換えました。
sen.e: In general, Shinchoku refers to following three shinchoku (Three Great Shinchoku) that were given by Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) to her grandson Ninigi (God of the Harvest) in the passage of Tensonkorin (the descent of the Sun-Goddess's grandson) recorded in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天壌無窮の神勅
sen.e: tenjomukyu (as eternal as heaven and earth) no shinchoku (oracle)
Tenjomukyu no Shinchoku
sen.cmt: 文が小文字で始まっています。
sen.e: Tenjomukyu no Shinchoku
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: -- 葦原千五百秋瑞穂の国は、是、吾が子孫の王たるべき地なり。
sen.e: Ashihara no chioaki no Mizuho no Kuni is the place that should be possessed by monarch, my descendent.
Ashihara Chihoaki Mizuho no Kuni (the eulogistic name for Japan; the Land of Abundant Reed Plains and Rice Fields), this is the land where my descentant shall reign.
sen.cmt: 「葦原千五百秋瑞穂」の読みは「あしはらちいほあきみずほ」です。「の」が入るものは、「葦原の千五百秋の瑞穂の国」と検索できます。補足には、（日本の美称；葦原千五百秋瑞穂の国の英訳）と入れます。（英訳は新和英大辞典より）
sen.e: Ashihara Chihoaki Mizuho no Kuni (the eulogistic name for Japan; the Land of Abundant Reed Plains and Rice Fields), this is the land where my descentant shall reign.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 爾皇孫、就でまして治らせ。
sen.e: Ninigi no Mikoto, go and govern steadily.
Imashi Sumemina (dear my child who carries out the will of the God of Heaven), take and fulfill the mission given, and be the one to reign.
sen.cmt: 爾皇孫（いましすめみな）：親愛なるあなた方宇宙絶対神の御心を正しく継承する真子、就で：与えられた任務に付いて、その役目を完全に成し遂げること治らせ：全体の中心者として、すべてを正しく知り、それぞれを竈材竈所に活かして、大調和させることといういみです。書き換えました。
sen.e: Imashi Sumemina (dear my child who carries out the will of the God of Heaven), take and fulfill the mission given, and be the one to reign.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 行矣。
sen.e: Go safely.
Be filled with gace and happiness.
sen.cmt: 行矣（さきくませ）：無限の無限の幸せで一杯という状態にすること。なので「幸あれ」というような意味であると思います。
sen.e: May you be filled with happiness.
sen.cmt: 変更しました。

sen.j: 宝祚の隆えまさむこと、当に天壌と窮り無けむ。
sen.e: The succession to the throne will lead to an unlimited prosperity.
The grace and goodness of the God of Heaven shall prosper and last eternally with heaven and earth.
sen.cmt: 宝祚：絶対神より承継した徳/幸運隆えまさむ：豊か・尊い・栄えるといういみで、「天壌と窮り無けむ」が続き、以下の意味になります。「絶対神より承継した徳は栄え、天地と共に永遠に続くだろう」
sen.e: The grace and goodness of the God of Heaven shall prosper and last eternally with heaven and earth.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝鏡奉斎の神勅
sen.e: oracle of hokyohosai (religious services of the temple)
Hokyohosai no Shinchoku (the oracle of hokyo (sacred mirror) dedication)
sen.cmt: 文が小文字で始まっています。不要なスペースを削除し、必要なスペースを加えました。先の「天壌無窮の神勅」とあわせ、-no-というスタイルで記載します。
sen.e: Hokyohosai no Shinchoku (the oracle of hokyo (sacred mirror) dedication)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: -- 吾が児、此の宝鏡を視まさむこと、当に吾を視るがごとくすべし。
sen.e: My child, when you look into this mirror, think of me.
My child, treat the hokyo as you have treated me.
sen.cmt: 「視まさむこと」「視るがごとくすべし」の意味は単に見るといいみでなく、「私に対し接するように鏡に対しなさい」という意味が適切であると思われます。
sen.e: My child, treat the hokyo as you have treated me.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 与に床を同くし殿を共にして、斎鏡をすべし。
sen.e: Live along with the mirror and treasure it.
Enshrine the mirror at your side as a goshintai (object of worship housed in a Shinto shrine and believed to contain the spirit of a deity) of Amaterasu Omikami.
sen.cmt: 「鏡を天照大神の御神体として常に大事に、身近に、お祭りしなさい」という意味が適切であると思います。
sen.e: Enshrine the mirror at your side as a goshintai (object of worship housed in a Shinto shrine and believed to contain the spirit of a deity) of Amaterasu Omikami.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 斎庭（ゆにわ）の稲穂の神勅
sen.e: oracle of rice ear of a funeral hall
Yuniwa no Inaho no Shinchoku (the oracle of the rice ear from Yuniwa (sacred field of the God))
sen.cmt: 文が小文字で始まっています。先の「天壌無窮の神勅」とあわせ、-no-というスタイルで記載します。斎庭とは、古神道用語で「神様が降りる場所」という意味で、葬式を行なう場所ではありません。
sen.e: Yuniwa no Inaho no Shinchoku (the oracle of the rice ear from Yuniwa (sacred field of the God))
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: -- 吾が高天原に所御す斎庭の穂を以て、亦吾が児に御せまつるべし。
sen.e: Give my child the rice ear that you can find in my heaven.
The rice ears grown by Amaterasu Omikami in the Heaven shall be handed to children, so grow them eternally in Mizuho no Kuni (the Land of Vigorous Rice Plants; Japan).
sen.cmt: 「天照大神が作った稲穂を子孫に任せるから、必ず瑞穂の国でいつまでも作りなさい」という意味です。
sen.e: The rice ears grown by Amaterasu Omikami in the Heaven shall be handed to children, so grow them eternally in Mizuho no Kuni (the Land of Vigorous Rice Plants; Japan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: さらに、同段で天照大神が臣下の天児屋命・太玉命に下した「侍殿防護の神勅」「神籬磐境の神勅」を併せて「五大神勅」という。
sen.e: "oracle of Jiden security" and "oracle of Himorogi Iwasaka (The place where God descends)"that Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) commanded to his subject, Amenokoyane no Mikoto and Futodama no Mikoto in the same paragraph are called as Godai (five elements) oracles.

Including 'Jidenbogo no Shinchoku' (commanding; the people shall never neglect loyalty towards Imperial family) and 'Himorogi Iwasaka no Shinchoku' (commanding; saishi (religious service) shall be based on prosperity of Imperial line) that Amaterasu Omikami commanded to her subject Amenokoyane no Mikoto and Futodama no Mikoto in the same passage, it is called 'Godai Shinchoku' (Five Great Shinchoku).
sen.cmt: 文が小文字で始まっています。不要なスペースを削除し、必要なスペースを加えました。天照大神は女神なので「his」ではありません。「侍殿防護の神勅」「神籬磐境の神勅」ともにタイトルの意味を訳しても意味が分からないため、簡単に内容を要約したものを補足として記載しました（下記）。「神籬磐境の神勅」（祭祀は皇統の弥栄えを基本とすること）「侍殿防護の神勅」（国民は皇室への忠誠を怠らぬこと）書き換えました。
sen.e: Including 'Jidenbogo no Shinchoku' (commanding; the people shall never neglect loyalty towards Imperial family) and 'Himorogi Iwasaka no Shinchoku' (commanding; saishi (religious service) shall be based on prosperity of Imperial line) that Amaterasu Omikami commanded to her subject Amenokoyane no Mikoto and Futodama no Mikoto in the same passage, it is called 'Godai Shinchoku' (Five Great Shinchoku).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その他
sen.e: others
Others
sen.cmt: 文が小文字で始まっています。
sen.e: Others
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天壌無窮の神勅については、古事記の天孫降臨の段にも以下のような同様の文章がある。
sen.e: Regarding the oracle of tenjomukyu (heaven and earth that continue eternally), there is a similar sentence such as "This Toyoashihara-no-Mizuhonokuni is the coutry you know." in the paragraph of tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess) of Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters).
The passage of Tensonkorin (the descent of the Sun-Goddess's grandson) recorded in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) also include a similar sentence regarding Tenjomukyu no Shinchoku.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除し、必要なスペースを加えました。「天壌無窮の神勅」を直しました。書き換えました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The passage of Tensonkorin (the descent of the Sun-Goddess's grandson) recorded in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) also include a similar sentence regarding Tenjomukyu no Shinchoku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「この豊葦原水穂国は、汝知らさむ国ぞと言依さしたまふ」
sen.e: Amaterasu Omikami entrusted and told, this Toyo Ashihara Mizuho no Kuni (the Land of Abundant Reed Plains and Rice Fields) is the land you reign'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処書き直しました。「知らさむ」も先に出た「すべてを正しく知り・・・」ということから、治める、という意味につながります。「言依さし」が誰が、とは記載されていませんが、この内容を委任したのは天照大神であるので、そのように訳しました。
sen.e: Amaterasu Omikami entrusted and told, this Toyo Ashihara Mizuho no Kuni (the Land of Abundant Reed Plains and Rice Fields) is the land you reign'.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文章はそれぞれに異るが、瓊瓊杵尊およびその子孫が君主となって日本を治めることは、神の意志に基づくものであるとする内容が共通している。
sen.e: Although the sentences differ to each other, there is a similarity in contents in a way that they both say that the government of Japan by Ninigi-no Mikoto and his descendant as a monarch is based on God's will and it had been considered that since the great-grandchild of Ninigi-no Mikoto, Iwarehiko succeded to the throne as the Emperor Jinmu, the position was inherited by the imperial family.

Although the sentences are different from each other, it shares the common context that it is the will of God for Ninigi-no Mikoto (grandson of Amaterasu Omikami) and his descendants to become the monarch and reign over Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処書き直しました。
sen.e: Although the sentences are different from each other, it shares the common context that it is the will of God for Ninigi-no Mikoto (grandson of Amaterasu Omikami) and his descendants to become the monarch and reign over Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 瓊瓊杵尊の曾孫磐余彦が神武天皇として即位して以来、その地位が天皇家によって受継がれてきたと、かつては考えられていた。
sen.e: It used to be considered that the position was succeeded to Imperial family since Iwarehikono, the great-grandson of Ninigi-no Mikoto, accede to the throne as Emperor Jimmu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It used to be considered that the position was succeeded to Imperial family since Iwarehikono, the great-grandson of Ninigi-no Mikoto, accede to the throne as Emperor Jimmu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 戦前期にあっては、天皇が日本の君主であることの、法制的・歴史的・宗教的根拠とされた（万世一系の項参照）。
sen.e: Before the war time, it was used as a legal, historical and religious evidence (refer to the section of unbroken imperial line) of the Emperor being the monarch of Japan.
In the prewar period, it was considered as a legal, historical and religious evidence (See 'Unbroken Imperial Line' for the reference) of the Emperor being the monarch of Japan.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除し、必要なスペースを加えました。「戦前期」をprewar period と訳しました。Used >> consideredと変更しました。補足内を変更しました。
sen.e: In the prewar period, it was considered as a legal, historical and religious evidence (See 'Unbroken Imperial Line' for the reference) of the Emperor being the monarch of Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神勅については、近世以前まではことさらな国粋主義的国学者などを別にすれば特に強調されることのない概念であった。
sen.e: Although the oracle was a notion that had not been especially emphasized till the early-modern times besides some nationalistic Japanese scholars, it was often used as a theoretical evidence to oppose against the expansion of power that oriented to republic or communism and the emperor-as-organ theory that became the main current accordingly to a rapid development of the modernization since the end period of Meiji era and it was used as one of the basis that supported the ideologies authorized by the government, combined with Kokoku Shikan (emperor-centered historiography which is based on state Shinto) and the national policy theory especially during war time.
Shinchoku was a concept that received less emphasis, except for nationalistic scholars of the Japanese classics, before modern times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処書き換えました。
sen.e: Shinchoku was a concept that received less emphasis, except for nationalistic scholars of the Japanese classics, before modern times.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、明治後期以降、急速な近代化の進展にともなって、共和政体や共産主義を志向する勢力の伸張や、天皇機関説が憲法学説において主流をなすようになると、これに対抗するための論理的根拠として用いられることが多くなった。
sen.e: However after the end period of Meiji period, it was often used as logical evidence against the movement of the Emperor Organ Theory becoming mainstream of Constitutional Theory and the expansion of groups aiming at a communism and a republican system of government, as modernization rapidly advanced.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処書き換えました。
sen.e: However, after the end of the Meiji period, with Japan's modernization advancing rapidly, the movements aiming to introduce a communist system of government and those aiming to introduce a republican one expanded, resulting in the theory that the Emperor was an organ of the state becoming the mainstream of Constitutional Theory; as a result, Shinchoku was often used as a rationale for opposing these movements.
sen.cmt: However after the end period of Meiji period→However, after the end of the Meiji period（統一リストに従いました）一部変更しました。

sen.j: 特に戦中にあっては皇国史観や国体論と結び付けられて、政府公認のイデオロギーを支える基盤のひとつとして用いられた。
sen.e: Especially during the war period, it was related to Kokoku Shikan (Emperor-centered historiography which is based on state Shinto) and national policy theory, to be used as one of foundation to support government authorized idea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処書き換えました。
sen.e: Especially during the war period, it was related to Kokoku Shikan (Emperor-centered historiography which is based on state Shinto) and national policy theory, to be used as one of foundation to support government authorized idea.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
